results.content:
This course covered all the topics but if you're expecting to take this course and imagining that you'll get command on every topic which is explained, then you are mistaken here. Because each tags, keywords or anything that is typed within the course is not explained like why or why not to use those things. 
For example: If he used tags that serves the purpose of creating a template, then he just used it right away where and when to use, but in detail explaination that how the tag works and why use only that and not using that might give what consequences, things like that is not explained.
So, for a beginner like me looking at such course for the first time, I gained nothing out of this course.
I can obviously, create what examples he put in the course by copy pasting his things but understanding level was not there, I cannot go ahead saying I learned the concept and now I can do anything I wish to using this xml and xslt.
You can copy paste same things that he explained in the course but beginners will not develop any understanding and feel empowered with the knowledge.

results.content:
Eingangs wurden zusätzlich zu den Web-Szenarien auch Szenarien im Datenaustausch genannt. Hierzu hätte ich gerne einen praktischen Bezug gesehen. 
Außerdem wäre es hilfreich eine Middleware-Technologie zu verwenden, um die Praxis zu vertiefen. 
Insgesamt war der Kurs zu kurz (auch als Crash-Kurs zu kurz, meiner Meinung nach) um sämtliche für mich relevante Themen abzudecken

results.content: This is a high level overview on what XML is and is used for however it could do with some sample sheets to work from or something similar.

results.content:
First of all it's a very basic level. 
Second - there'is no files for download.
So if you want to try examples you may have some troubles. 
A: In Chrome you need  --allow-file-access-from-files parametr.
B: You need to handmade copypaste every file. 
Toshendra Sharma are not typing very well, so you need to pause lecture, typing from sreen to your editor and go on. 
Specialy when we have new templates theme.
Third, my main headache the <xsl:message> 
Terminate = {"yes"|"no"} - there is ok. 
But where is message??!
Only i see is a blank screen.  

It's very very difficult to listen to the lecturer. Sorry bro.

results.content: I didn't find it useful at all. I am an experience developer, but with zero experience in XSLT. I took the course hoping to find answers to a puntual problem we have in my office but all the contents of  the course I had manage to figure out for my self during my office hours. It is a very very basic course. Nothing to right home about.
